channel.title: REP++ Easy Help needed
channel.description:
Need some easy help.
I will rep.
I just need the codes, To add where Admins Cannot pk or trade or drop.

item.title: REP++ Easy Help needed
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Server Creator Brian:

Well theres more things you have to go through in a 508. 317s almost everything is in client.java.

No, like I said earlier. That’s just a file. If you took the time to work some things out of it, then it wouldn’t all be in there. You could make handlers similar to the ones you have in a 508. Go download BlazeScape Reborn, it’s packaged like that. You’ll see.

item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Server Creator Brian:

Lmfao… cocoa, may i see a server you coded please?

I have yet to make one from scratch but I may soon so that I can learn the packet sending between client and server for login. I have worked on several servers though. Butterscape being my first ever server. Followed by Butterscape 503(fullscreen), then Butterscape 508, then Project Covic, and my latest unfinished work is Blazescape Reborn.

item.title: REP++ Easy Help needed
item.dc:creator: @bloodmaniet bloodmaniet
item.description:
@bloodmaniet wrote:

well idk how to add the pking prob… but add a interboolean to make them not go pass a certain point… but here is the trade/drop item for admins…
Drop item:
1.) search for: Dropitem
2.) you should see something like this…

[code] }
public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) {
// misc.printlnTag(“droppeditem [”+playerItems[slot]+"] which is
// ["+(droppedItem+1)+"]");
boolean a = true;

if (playerRights == 0) {
sM(“Admins cannot drop items.”);
return ;
}[/code]
3.) change the 0 to playerRights 2 and there u go… or u can copy and paste it for the boolean…

Trading:
1.) Search: Other player is busy
2.) scroll down and u should see…

sM("Other player is busy at the moment."); return; } if(action == 1){ return; } if(other.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)){ sM("Other player is busy at the moment."); return; } if(other.action == 1){ return; } if(other.playerRights == 2){ sM("Admins cannot trade."); return; } if(playerRights == 2){ sM("Admins cannot trade."); return; }

all u have to do is replace that and there u go… it should work but if ur not good at adding things… make a copy of ur client.java

Read full topic

item.title: REP++ Easy Help needed
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

Just think of a similar method you already had and add an adaptation to it. It’s really easy. For example: for trading search for “Other player is busy at the moment.” and you’ll find a method which determines when a players is busy so it can prevent a trade from taking place - simply add a new part that checks for playerRights instead. For Pking, search for something which prevents combat when a player is already fighting and add something that again, checks for playerRights.

Read full topic

item.title: REP++ Easy Help needed
item.dc:creator: @Server_Creator_Brian Server Creator Brian
item.description:
@Server_Creator_Brian wrote:

Actually… yes there is… want me to quote it for you?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 18, 2009, 03:09:43 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Taharok”]There are several modifications to the rules, as well as a reformatting. Due to such changes, the new rules are being posted here instead of being updated in the old topic.

All of the following rules must be followed while posting in this section. Failure to do so will result in a lock and possible warnings or moderations.

  1. All topics in this section must be requests for help on a server. Any non-server related question will be locked. Requesting a hoster, coder, or asking about a VPS also falls under being non-server related.

  2. All topic bodies must follow this post.

3. We are not a Spoonfeeding community. We do not teach in an oversimplified manner to discourage independent thought. We encourage independent thought, meaning you must help yourselves before requesting help. Failure to provide some sort of prior knowledge or work to the problem will result in a lock of the topic. This is final.

  1. Excessive spamming or flaming, as a rule of thumb, will result in one to two week warnings or moderations. Repetitive excessive flaming will result in worse punishments. This means, the more posts full of excessive flaming there are in the topics, the worse each punishment will be individually. Same applies to spamming.

  2. Make sure the titles of your topics are easy to read and are completely relevant to the topic at hand. Though this rule may be bent from time to time, make sure you follow it. A moderator on a bad day could easily lock a topic for breaking this rule.

  3. Advertising is strictly forbidden in this section AND all others. Multiple advertising will result in a mute or a ban as advertising is getting out of hand. Take it to the Server Status page located HERE.

All the above rules may change time to time. The above rules are not exact, they are mere center guidelines for moderators. A moderator is not required to reply to a topic they locked, though they are encouraged to. The above are also mere major rules that apply throughout the section, but if a moderator has their own reason in locking a topic, so may it be.[/quote][br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 18, 2009, 03:11:02 pm[/size][hr]The one in bold, my friend.

Read full topic
